DOC.brief_summary: Purpose The purpose PROLUCA study investigate efficacy early postoperative rehabilitation non-hospital setting patient operable lung cancer , focus exercise training . Design/Methods One hundred twenty-eight ( n=128 ) participant ( 64 patients/study arm ) Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer ( NSCLC ) , stage I-IIIa , refer surgery , randomize one follow two group : 1 . Early postoperative rehabilitation initiate early two week surgery 2 . Postoperative rehabilitation initiate 14 week surgery Intervention The intervention consist supervise group exercise program comprising resistance cardiorespiratory exercise two hour weekly 12 week combine individual counseling . The primary study endpoint Maximal oxygen uptake measure VO2peak test ( direct measurement ) Secondary endpoint include : Six minute walk distance ( 6MWD ) , One-repetition-maximum ( 1RM ) Patient-reported outcome ( PROs ) health relate quality life , fatigue , depression , lifestyle , postoperative complication , hospitalization time , sick leave , work status survival . Results The result PROLUCA identify optimal timing postoperative rehabilitation NSCLC patient focus increase physical capacity health relate quality life reduce side effect treatment cancer disease .
